SecurityMeasures: Input validation to prevent unrestricted URL redirection

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to understand how the web application works and identify any vulnerabilities.
StepDetails.Action: Review the web application by inspecting the source code, analyzing the network traffic, or using automated scanning tools.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers that the web application has multiple redirections and that each page has one letter for the name.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to find a way to discover the full flag by analyzing the redirections.
StepDetails.Action: Start analyzing the requested pages and adjust the starting point of the redirections to see if they reveal any information.
StepDetails.Result: By analyzing the redirections, the attacker discovers that each page reveals one letter of the flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker's goal is to obtain the full flag by gathering all the letters revealed through the redirections.
StepDetails.Action: Collect all the letters revealed by the redirections and combine them to form the flag.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully gathers all the letters and obtains the flag: RS{4!way5_Ke3p-m0v1ng}
